title: Piers Morgan
summary: Piers Stefan Pughe-Morgan  (/pɪərs/; né O'Meara; born 30 March 1965) is an English broadcaster, journalist, writer, and television personality. He began his Fleet Street career in 1988 at The Sun. In 1994, aged 29, he was appointed editor of the News of the World by Rupert Murdoch, which made him the youngest editor of a British national newspaper in more than half a century.[1] From 1995, Morgan edited the Daily Mirror, but was sacked in 2004.[2] He was the editorial director of First News during 2006 to 2007.
